text: summer in Moscow a city that still feels
more prosperous and more at ease with
itself than it used to
despite the sunshine though many worry
once plentiful economic opportunities
are drying up the sanctions bite in a
society more more split between the
majority who support president and those
who fear Russia is on the wrong path
with their dreams of more liberal
country fading fast LaVon is one of the
professionals planning to leave to study
in America his soon-to-be ex-wife is
staying here their political differences
help drive them apart
politically I feel as though the Iron
Curtain is coming back down censorship
is tightening and some strange laws have
been introduced recently it's like an
alarm bell for me warning that the
situation could go down here for some
time Olga says the war in Ukraine has
led to bitter arguments between family
and friends she too is planning to
emigrate so what does she hope for
abroad stability properly provided by
the rule of law no matter who's the
president today or tomorrow stability so
that normal people like me can live in
peace and stop worrying over the past
few years the Russian middle class is
doubled in size to around 40% of the
population but some are now predicting
that could shrink over the next few
years to just 30% for some of the best
educated and highest skilled leave in
what some people call a new Russian
brain drain of course all countries who
lose their best minds suffer the current
outflow from Russia is not just a brain
drain there are people who did business
or worked in finance and the way the
first around for the West so we've had
an outflow of capital in the last two
years as well for those who see
themselves as true Russian Patriots like
the pro-government demonstrators of the
National Liberation Movement the
professionals who are leaving a
traitor's to their country which
banging about normal citizens here feels
the rise of Russia especially after the
return of Crimea many people want to
move here so those traitors who want to
leave I want them to wake up and
remember their fathers and grandfathers
who fought for the motherland to the
bitter Alice to build the biggest
strongest country in the world the
numbers leaving may be small but many of
them are the very people Russia can ill
afford to lose Karen white BBC news
Moscow
